page.title: 01OUR LOCAL TIP.
page.content: The tip is very near a place called De Brooke Pool. It is a large clay pit split into two; one half is a tip. Both are filled with water which is very dirty and deep. Although it is full of oil and rubbish, there are sticklebacks, newts and frogs in there. Now the tip is being filled in and the rubbish buried. Soil has been pushed into a big wall to divide the two halves. A lot of people ride down there on their bikes because there are some jumps for BMX riding. The tip is surrounded by rough fields and unused ground and is owned by Trafford Borough Council. The clay has been used for brick making for many years, but ages ago clay was taken to build pots for cooking. It may even have been used in the Stone Age.
